column4: In Vista, for example, I can see a list of available networks... in Ubuntu, I don't... I'm a newbie with Ubuntu.. maybe I'm doing something wrong
do you have a network-manager icon in your taskbar?
I have an artheros card in a sony laptop
you should see a list of networks to choose from there...
in a shell try /sbin/iwlist scan, see if it reports networks
I get lo        Interface doesn't support scanning.
um, so you don't have an interface for your wireless card?
I tried to use the madwifi program but it wouldn't compile properly
is there a kernel module loaded for it? try lsmod | grep ath_pci
and /sbin/ifconfig only reports lo and eth0 interfaces?
